articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Missions 
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to DPRK missions in different countries by high-ranking officials, political parties, organizations and institutions of those countries in celebration of the 57th birthday of the DPRK.
 Among them were the chairman of the Central Committee of the National Construction Front of Laos who is member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, and the minister of Public Security of Laos, the deputy general secretary of the Arab Socialist Baath Party, the president of the People's Assembly, the prime minister and the minister of Defence of Syria, the president of the Senate, the vice-prime minister who is minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, the vice-prime minister who is co-minister of the Interior, the senior minister who is minister of Commerce, the senior minister who is minister of Finance and the Economy and the minister of Health of Cambodia, the foreign minister of India and the deputy secretary of the General People's Committee of Libya, and the People's Party, the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia, the Phnom Penh Municipal Office of Cambodia, and the New Left Movement, the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students and the Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Peru and the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship.    
 The floral baskets were laid before the portraits of President      Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the missions.

articles.title: DPRK Hailed
articles.content:
DPRK Hailed 
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- Figures of the Communist Party of Syria (Bagdash) and the Lebanese Communist Party issued statements on the occasion of the 57th birthday of the DPRK. 
 Abdul Wahab Rashwani, member of the Political Bureau of the Syrian party, said in his statement on Sept. 4 that the DPRK, founded and developed by President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, has become a powerful fortress of anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle and a symbol of victorious socialism under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who is winning brilliant victories with his ever-victorious Songun politics. 
 The Communist Party of Syria (Bagdash) is convinced that under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea the Korean people will achieve the reunification of the country and build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation without fail, overcoming all difficulties and ordeals, the statement said, adding: The two parties will further strengthen support and solidarity with each other in the same front of the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle.    
 The representative of the Lebanese Communist Party in Syria, said in his statement on Sept. 5 that the achievements and experience gained by the DPRK shining with the august names of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in socialist construction and anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle serve as a textbook showing the road ahead of the progressive humankind and revolutionary parties the world over to follow.
 The Lebanese people fully support the just struggle waged by the friendly Workers' Party and the people of Korea under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, he stated.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Forces Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Forces Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- A people's rally was reportedly held in Inchon, south Korea, on Sept. 11 in demand of the U.S. forces' pullback to put an end to their 60 year-long presence in south Korea.
 Attending it were at least 5,000 members of civic and public organizations.
 Jong Kwang Hun, permanent representative of the "National People's Solidarity," Ri Hye Son, chairperson of the Reunification Committee of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, and other speakers said at the rally that the U.S. forces landed in south Korea, revealing true colors as aggressors, and held that the statue of MacArthur, a symbol of the occupation forces, should be removed without fail.
 They said that south Korean people can not starve to death for the U.S. to be well-off and that workers, peasants and all other people should turn out in the campaign for the U.S. forces' pullback to put an end to such pain.    
 The U.S. forces in south Korea who are scheming for a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula are the first object for the settlement of the past, they stressed.
 A declaration was made public at the rally, which called upon all the fellow countrymen to further strengthen the unity and cohesion under the banner of anti-U.S., anti-war struggle and certainly terminate the 60 year-long U.S. military presence in south Korea and make this year a year of the withdrawal of the U.S. forces.
 Then, the participants urged the removal of the statue of MacArthur, holding slogan boards with letters "Withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea."

articles.title: Japanese Politicians Urged to Stop Visiting Yasukuni Shrine
Anti-U.S. Cultural Events Held in S. Korea
Neo-Liberal Policy Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
Neo-Liberal Policy Accused in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean People's Action against Neo-Liberalism and Globalization and the People's Action against the World Trade Organization reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on Sept. 8 blasting the authorities' unpopular neo-liberal policy.
 Workers have become jobless or part-time workers and most of the peasants left their native land after losing their land and common people are saddled with a huge amount of debt due to the neo-liberal policy of the authorities, the organizations deplored.
 Accusing the authorities of conducting humiliating free trade negotiations aimed at leaving the local markets to the tender mercies of foreign forces under the signboard of "globalization," they urged the authorities to immediately give up the policy of causing poverty, despair, the yawning gap between the rich and the poor and inequality in society.

articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for New York
    Pyongyang, September 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Vice- Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon left here Wednesday to attend the 60th UN General Assembly.
 It was seen off at the airport by officials concerned.
